results.title: Tchaikovsky's Romeo and Juliet
results.creator_credit: George Richfield, George Freedland and Official Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Musical masterpieces”.
The Radio Philharmonic Orchestra of Italy, under the gaton of Fernando Previtali, perform Tchaikovsky’s romantic suite, “Romeo and Juliet”.

results.title: Taxithi
results.creator_credit: Peter Tammer, Victorian College of the Arts and Christina Heristanidis
results.brief_description: Taxithi, which means “journey” in Greek, examines an integral but often overlooked and under-represented part of Australian contemporary society: migrant culture. Melbourne filmmaker Christina Heristanidis turns the camera on her immediate surroundings, specifically, her Greek parents, their culture and history in order to understand and appreciate their Greek-Australianess. As well as capturing her parents relaxing at home or attending their social clubs, Christina also accompanies them on a road trip they take to the country with their community of friends. The manner in which they deal with encounters and express themselves through their culture (singing, dancing, communal happiness) as a group evokes the film’s central theme: that migrants bring their culture with them, that culture continues through people rather than solely through place and that this shared culture enables community, solace and optimism. In “Taxithi”, the camera becomes an extension of the filmmaker that often turns onto the filmmaker herself and her own relations with her parents. Never short of humour, warmth and goodwill, “Taxithi” is a special documentary that reveals the richness and history that lies below the surface of everyday Australian suburbia.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Peter Tammer, Victorian College of the Arts and Christina Heristanidis

results.title: Taxi to Rumdoodle
results.brief_description: Tells the story of the hardy taxi to Rumdoodle, which takes passengers over the snow and ice to Mawson base from the airstrip at Rumdoodle in Antarctica. Shows how the car stands up to the cold weather, and rough conditions, saving the snow-cat and tractors for other work and maintaining speeds of 40-50 m.p.h. on sea ice. Shows the penguins, seals and huskies, typical scenery and the men of the A.N.A.R.E. at work at the base and on inland expeditions.

results.title: Taxi driver [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Columbia Pictures, Julia Phillips, Michael Phillips and Martin Scorsese
results.brief_description: Robert de Niro plays Travis Bickle, a Vietnam veteran who takes up driving a cab at night in New York City. The job brings him into contact with what he calls the “scum and sewerage, the pimps and pushers” of the city. He attempts to find redemption through love, first for the politically ambitious and sophisticated Betsy (Cybill Shepherd), and, when he is rejected, by rescuing a 12 year old prostitute (Jodie Foster) from her pimp. When love fails Travis, he is provoked into an act of savage violence as his judgement on the world. The film is infamous for having influenced American President Reagan’s would-be assassin John Hinkley, but it is more significant for portraying the paralyzing decay and resultant psycho-pathology of American urban life. Scripted by Paul Schrader, “Taxi Driver” is one of Scorsese’s masterworks. Cast also includes Harvey Keitel.

results.title: Tawny scrawny lion
results.creator_credit: Allan Frank Sandler, Sandler Institutional Films and Zagreb Film
results.brief_description: An animated cartoon about a scrawny lion who is always hungry and a rabbit who talks the lion out of eating all the other animals of the forest. The rabbit not only befriends the lion but finds a way to satisfy the lion’s hunger. Based on the book of the same title by Kathryn Jackson. Consultant Chuck Jones. Suitable for lower and middle primary levels.

results.title: Taupo holiday
results.brief_description: Tourist promotion film of activities on and around Lake Taupo, New Zealand. Featured items include: Spa Hotel; Waikato River; Wairaki Valley and thermal activity; fishing for rainbow trout.

results.title: Tattoos
results.creator_credit: Mark Bayly and Australian Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Couchman over Australia”.
Peter Couchman hosts a studio discussion on tattoos and why people wear them. He leads a debate on whether tattoos should be recognised as a legitimate art form. The audience is shown a tattoo being applied during the debate.

results.title: Taste
results.creator_credit: Victorian College of the Arts and Lisa Dombroski
results.brief_description: An energetic short romantic comedy, with a transsexual twist. As Suz’s relationship with her rock musician boyfriend, who is also the father of her young son, grinds to an end, she becomes attracted to Danny, the chef at the restaurant where she works. Danny is the antithesis of her insensitive boyfriend and seduces her with food and humour. Yet thrill and excitement of discovering new love, is temporarily dampened by the emotional confusion Suz experiences when she discovers that Danny was once a woman. Cast includes Kate Oliver, Peter Barron, Sullivan Stapleton and Billy Havir-Smith.

results.title: Tasmanian wild life
results.creator_credit: Don Anderson and Tasmanian State Film Unit
results.brief_description: Tasmania’s characteristic rough mountainous terrain serves as a sanctuary for preserving its natural wildlife. Features the Tasmanian devil and Tasmanian tiger.
